page.title: 11ST.MARYS LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: St. Mary the Virgin is the only Church of England church in Little Baddow,but there is a Methodist chapel and a United Reformed church in the area.The major religion in Little Baddow is Christianity. From the outside the church looks like a castle with butresses and a tower.The north west and south west butresses are angled to support the heavy tower,which is 52ft high and is 14th century in origin. On the north wall there is evidence that the church dates from Norman times as the masonry is 11th and 12th century.There are also Roman tiles used in the construction,these were found on the site and once formed part of a hypocaust system. The south porch is interesting as it contains medieval timbers and a 300 year old lantern.
